Author: davidw
Content: This ought to be good for a few rounds.  I must admit a certain guilty pleasure in seeing someone take them on.

Author: davidw
Content: PG has to have read 'worse is better'.  I wonder what his motivations are for going against 'release early, release often'?  Perhaps it's a case of people's expectations being pretty high, and ready to pounce if it's not perfect, which it probably isn't, given that it hasn't been shaken down that much (or at least not by a wide audience).

Author: portLAN
Content:
It's not maturity, it's caution. People are more careful when their real names are attached.

It's also not a good comparison because the set of options is completely different; it's like arguing whether a trout makes fewer programming mistakes than a human. There are no interactive 3D zoophile sex dungeons in Facebook to use your "free will" to avoid. (Facebook app, anyone?)

Author: tomek
Content: unless of course it's an inside job :-)

Author: tomek
Content: It looks like Facebook and Microsoft like each other. So Google is just doing what any other company would most likely do.

Author: stevefroeber
Content: Also in Atlanta.  Interested to hear about how things are "heating up" here.  I'd love to chat with some of you from ATL too.

Author: lkozma
Content: For google, all regional domains are counted separately, google.com, .de, .ro, etc., while for youtube, as far as I know there's only .com that's viewed all over the world.

Author: zach
Content:
Second Life's user base has an average age of 32 IIRC.

And yet the maturity level is higher on Facebook. Or does SL just get bad press in this area?

Author: henning
Content: I love PHP normally and I love it even more when it doesn't have syntax highlighting or indenting and isn't even displayed in a fixed-width font!

Title: Facebook lesson: Who Owns the Concept if No One Signs the Papers?
